pr_title: Implemented a JsonSolutionFileIO for benchmark input solution files

timeline.bodyText: Naming wise, let's use the word Jackson in here, in case we build a Jsonb version too.
timeline.author: ge0ffrey

replies.bodyText: I changed the class JsonSolutionFileIO to JacksonSolutionFileIO which is much more appropriate.
replies.author: cemnura

timeline.bodyText:
This was the only assertion that this SolutionFileIO unit test had.
I am not sure how to make these the same objects with Jackson
timeline.author: cemnura

replies.bodyText: @ge0ffrey would this assertion in the unit test be of any importance?
replies.author: cemnura

timeline.bodyText: Could provide more documentation to explain the construction with Jackson ObjectMapper
timeline.author: cemnura

timeline.message:
Implemented a JsonSolutionFileIO for benchmark input solution files

Signed-off-by: Cem Nura <cem.nura@gmail.com>

Implemented a JsonSolutionFileIO for benchmark input solution files

Signed-off-by: Cem Nura <cem.nura@gmail.com>

Added usage documentation for JsonSolutionFileIO

Signed-off-by: Cem Nura <cem.nura@gmail.com>

Fixed format violation

Signed-off-by: Cem Nura <cem.nura@gmail.com>

Removed redundant cast

Signed-off-by: Cem Nura <cem.nura@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Please make the class final, the fields private final.
timeline.author: triceo

replies.bodyText:
Sure thing i could convert the fields to be private final. Since the clazz and the mapper should never be changed after initialization.
However, wouldn't making the class final prevent clients from extending this SolutionFileIO implementation for there own planning solution.
Therefore, clients would not be able to use the SolutionFileIO as explained in the documentation similar to XStreamSolutionFIleIO.
I made fields private final and waiting for your feedback on making the class final.
replies.author: cemnura

replies.bodyText: Good point on the class. I forgot we would be extending it. Nevermind then.
replies.author: triceo

replies.bodyText: Great! Should I mark as resolved?
replies.author: cemnura

timeline.bodyText:
I would like to see a proof of concept that this actually works. The following article suggests that it is possible with some extra annotations on the data model:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18306040/jackson-deserialize-jsonidentityreference-alwaysasid-true/29742035#29742035
You may need to adapt JacksonTestdataSolution to get it done.
timeline.author: triceo

replies.bodyText:
I tried the article you provided. However, I was unable to find any success.
I stumbled upon the following suggestion:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37640985/jackson-referencing-the-same-object
This way I was able de-serialize the objects string values as one object. Therefore, assertion that theJacksonTestdataValue code field are the same objects.
However, this assertion seems to be a Jackson feature rather then enabling loading an JSON input solution file with jackson.
I added the the code to enable this assertion to be successful so you could observe. Would reorganize upon your approval.
replies.author: cemnura

timeline.message:
Converted fields to private final

Signed-off-by: Cem Nura <cem.nura@gmail.com>

Enabled same string values to be the same object when Jackson deserialization

Signed-off-by: Cem Nura <cem.nura@gmail.com>

Fixed format violation

Enabled jackson-annotations dependency to be test scoped

Signed-off-by: Cem Nura <cem.nura@gmail.com>
